content: I fixed up the very confusing statement. I fixed up the bit where it said "round up" and clarified what is meant by the "odd numbers" rather than "odd operator". I also included 1 in the factorial sequences since it doesn't change anything and is less confusing.

the "round up only the result" is wrong.
You have to round to the nearest int 
round up-> math.ceil()
round down-> math.floor()
round to nearest int ->round()

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept the contribution because it works.
my python solution is
"""
n = int(input())
res = n
for i in range(n-1,0,-1):
    if i%2 == 1:
        res /= i
    else:
        res*=i
print(round(res))
This is nice for clash of codes though why does 1 not included in factorial but it won't really matter to the output so it's fine.

1) The definition of an "odd" operator is not clear. You should provide a more complete exemple (7! for instance). And I think you make a confusion between operator and operands.
2) Only Code size clash ? I think it should be ok in time mode
3) You had to treat exception, and/or specify constraints on at least inputs (N>=0 ? N>1 ?). Upper bounds should be also provide (N<20), since some clash requires optimized algorithm for big numbers management, this is not the case here.

Will not reject because these are not big issues but : 
1 - Include CONSTRAINTS. Give a range for n.
1b. for instance if n is 0, in theory the clasher would need to code a special case
2 - Maybe include the 1 in factorial, it's usually how factorial is defined :p.
I really like this clash ! Fast and concise one !
Same comment on round up, also you have a typo (ode -> odd)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quick and easy once we understand the problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Just precise round up to the nearest otherwise your description is not clear enough.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: you must give more precisions about the asked rounding operation  in your statements (round up, down ? round to the closiest ?)

Everything else is ok for me so if you change that point i will change my vote !

Goal section
* It is better to clarify that rounding applies to the final result only, not after every division.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
